subject: RE: [junit] Ordering Test  _Output_ ?
msgSnippet: ... Ooh.  I ve never seen that mentioned before!  I ll have to try it! ... Well, ya, but what if you re debugging your tests? ;)  (Or some dingleberry kills
messageBody:
On Tue, 3 Apr 2001, Robert Watkins wrote:

> Joi and Mathieu,
>
> One possibility is to nest your tests. TestX can invoke TestY if it depends
> on that behaviour.

Ooh. I've never seen that mentioned before! I'll have to try it!

> The other possibility is to run your tests more often. :) If you haven't
> changed much since the last successful run, you know what must have broken
> your tests even without inspecting the test output.

Well, ya, but what if you're debugging your tests? ;) (Or some dingleberry
kills your server process and doesn't tell you?)

--
Joi Ellis Software Engineer
Aravox Technologies joi@..., gyles19@...

No matter what we think of Linux versus FreeBSD, etc., the one thing I
really like about Linux is that it has Microsoft worried. Anything
that kicks a monopoly in the pants has got to be good for something.
- Chris Johnson
